bill_title: Honoring Tate Sutton as the 2003 one hundred twelve pound South Dakota State B Wrestling Champion with a 43-0 record.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Tate Sutton as the 2003 one hundred twelve pound South Dakota State B Wrestling Champion with a 43-0 record. WHEREAS, Tate Sutton showed superior dedication throughout his high school wrestling career and has set a standard for other student athletes to follow; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton is actively involved in the Flandreau youth wrestling program and has been a role model for young wrestlers in his community; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton was selected as Athlete of the Month at Flandreau High School for his outstanding wrestling season; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton is also actively involved in FFA and 4-H; and WHEREAS, head coach Blake Bergjord and assistant coach Justin Richter showed exceptional leadership in helping Tate Sutton achieve his goal in becoming the one hundred twelve pound South Dakota State B Wrestling Champion: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Tate Sutton be recognized for his extraordinary accomplishment of winning a 2002-2003 state wrestling title and for his continued success.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Tate Sutton as the 2003 one hundred twelve pound South Dakota State B Wrestling Champion with a 43-0 record. WHEREAS, Tate Sutton showed superior dedication throughout his high school wrestling career and has set a standard for other student athletes to follow; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton is actively involved in the Flandreau youth wrestling program and has been a role model for young wrestlers in his community; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton was selected as Athlete of the Month at Flandreau High School for his outstanding wrestling season; and WHEREAS, Tate Sutton is also actively involved in FFA and 4-H; and WHEREAS, head coach Blake Bergjord and assistant coach Justin Richter showed exceptional leadership in helping Tate Sutton achieve his goal in becoming the one hundred twelve pound South Dakota State B Wrestling Champion: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Tate Sutton be recognized for his extraordinary accomplishment of winning a 2002-2003 state wrestling title and for his continued success.
